derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English māst, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch meest and German meist

encyclopedia.content: 什么是MOST汽车光纤线？ MOST----Media Oriented System Transport MOST 系统是利用光导纤维作为信息传导媒介，进行数字信号的传输。首先各控制元件将电磁脉冲信号转化为光脉冲信号，传送到光纤上，而后相应的接收电脑又将光脉冲信号转换回电磁脉冲信号，从而完成相应的控制功能。由于MOST 系统的高传输速率，因此它可以做到只用两根光纤即可同时传递多路信号。 面向媒体的系统传输(Media Oriented Systems Transport，MOST)是在

entry.def: You use most to refer to the majority of a group of things or people or the largest part of something.

example.ex: Most of the houses in the capital don't have piped water...
example.tran: 首都的大部分房屋没有自来水。

example.ex: By stopping smoking you are undoing most of the damage smoking has caused...
example.tran: 通过戒烟可以消除吸烟造成的大部分危害。

entry.def: You use the most to mean a larger amount than anyone or anything else, or the largest amount possible.

example.ex: The President himself won the most votes...
example.tran: 总统本人获得最多选票。

example.ex: The skippers get the most money, and after them the cooks...
example.tran: 船长拿到的钱最多，其次是厨师。

entry.def: You use most to indicate that something is true or happens to a greater degree or extent than anything else.

example.ex: What she feared most was becoming like her mother...
example.tran: 她最怕的就是变得像她妈妈那样。

example.ex: What they wanted most from the president was a leader who at least would try to educate the country.
example.tran: 他们对总统最大的期待是，至少他应尽力教诲国民。

entry.def: You use most to indicate that someone or something has a greater amount of a particular quality than most other things of its kind.

example.ex: Her children had the best, most elaborate birthday parties in the neighborhood...
example.tran: 她的孩子们的生日聚会在街坊四邻里是最好、最讲究的。

example.ex: He was one of the most influential performers of modern jazz...
example.tran: 他是现代爵士乐最有影响力的表演者之一。

entry.tran: 最大限度地;最频繁地;最多地
entry.def: If you do something the most, you do it to the greatest extent possible or with the greatest frequency.

example.ex: What question are you asked the most?...
example.tran: 你们被问及最多的问题是什么？

example.ex: Inevitably those who suffer the most are the mothers and children...
example.tran: 妇女和儿童必然是最遭罪的。

entry.tran: (在谈话中用于引起注意)最…，极其…
entry.def: You use most in conversations when you want to draw someone's attention to something very interesting or important that you are about to say.

example.ex: Most surprisingly, quite a few said they don't intend to vote at all...
example.tran: 最让人吃惊的是，相当多的人说他们根本不打算参加投票。

example.ex: Most interestingly, they are  demanding that a national working party on crimes against women and children be established.
example.tran: 最令人关注的是，他们要求针对侵害妇女和儿童的犯罪成立全国专案组。

entry.def: You use most to emphasize an adjective or adverb.

example.ex: I'll be most pleased to speak to them...
example.tran: 能跟他们谈谈我会十分高兴。

example.ex: I believe he is most painfully anxious about Diana.
example.tran: 我相信他肯定非常担心黛安娜。

entry.def: You use at most or at the most to say that a number or amount is the maximum that is possible and that the actual number or amount may be smaller.

example.ex: Poach the pears in apple juice for perhaps ten minutes at most.
example.tran: 把梨放入苹果汁中，最多煮10分钟左右。

example.ex: ...staying on at school for two extra years to study only three, or at the most four subjects...
example.tran: 在学校再多呆两年学习仅仅三门、至多四门课程

entry.def: If you make the most of something, you get the maximum use or advantage from it.

example.ex: Happiness is the ability to make the most of what you have...
example.tran: 幸福就是有能力充分享受你拥有的一切。

example.ex: Making the most of your hair means getting the cut and shape right.
example.tran: 让头发达到最佳效果意味着要修剪得当，并选择合适的发型。

means.word_mean: 1. (superlative of `many' used with count nouns and often preceded by `the') quantifier meaning the greatest in number;
2. the superlative of `much' that can be used with mass nouns and is usually preceded by `the'; a quantifier meaning the greatest in amount or extent or degree;

sentences.sentence: "made the most of a bad deal"
"the king cobra is the most dangerous snake"

means.word_mean: 3. (of actions or states) slightly short of or not quite accomplished; `near' is sometimes used informally for `nearly' and `most' is sometimes used informally for `almost';

sentences.sentence: "the baby was almost asleep when the alarm sounded"
"the car all but ran her down"
"virtually all the parties signed the contract"
"I was near exhausted by the run"

list.explanation: [黑人用语]随和、从容、沉着的人

example.en: He was a chilly most and liked smart, re-laxed cloth.
example.zh: 他为人随和、沉着，衣着方面也喜欢随意的家常便服。

sentences.en: It was the most exciting holiday I've ever had.
sentences.cn: 那是我经历过的最令人兴奋的假日。

sentences.en: Of course you're the most aristocratic of the two of us.
sentences.cn: 你当然是我们两个人中最有贵族气派的。

sentences.en: He spoke most bitterly of his experiences in prison.
sentences.cn: 他非常痛苦地讲述了他在监狱中的经历。

means.word_mean: 大多数, 大部分,几乎所有

sentences.en: We spend most of March ploughing.
sentences.cn: 三月份的大部分时间我们都在春耕。

sentences.en: Most of her books were stolen.
sentences.cn: 她的大部分书都被偷走了。

sentences.en: Peter made the most mistakes of all the class.
sentences.cn: 全班同学中, 彼得出的错最多。

jushi.english: I received a most unusual present from my aunt.
jushi.chinese: 我收到姨妈给我的一件极不寻常的礼物。

jushi.english: He plays cards most every evening.
jushi.chinese: 他几乎每个晚上都打牌。

jushi.english: He spoke most bitterly of his experiences in prison.
jushi.chinese: 他十分痛苦地讲述了他在监狱中的经历。
